alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Logan (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 30 at 6:08PM CDT until April 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LOGAN...NORTHWESTERN DE WITT AND MCLEAN COUNTIES... At 608 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near McLean, or 12 miles southwest of Bloomington, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bloomington, Normal, Heyworth, Lexington, Chenoa, Atlanta, Colfax, Downs, McLean, Towanda, Waynesville, Cooksville, Pleasant Hill, Arrowsmith, Cropsey, Ellsworth, Lawndale, Anchor, Holder and Moraine View State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 39 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 55 between mile markers 132 and 187. Interstate 74 between mile markers 126 and 146. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
